body.name: HP 14" Latest Stream Laptop Ultral Light for Students and Business, Intel Celeron 16GB RAM, 320GB Storage (64GB eMMC+256GB Micro SD), 1 Year Office 365, HDMI, WiFi, USB-A&C, Win 11 +GM Accessory
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 15 hrs 30 mins
features: 【14" HD Display】14.0-inch diagonal, HD (1366 x 768), micro-edge, BrightView. With virtually no bezel encircling the display, an ultra-wide viewing experience provides for seamless multi-monitor set-ups

【Processor & Graphics】Intel Celeron N4120, 4 Cores & 4 Threads, 1.10 GHz Base Frequency, Up to 2.60 GHz Burst Frequency, 4 MB Cahce, Intel UHD Graphics 600, Handle multitasking reliably with the perfect combination of performance, power consumption, and value.

【RAM & Storage】Upgraded to 16GB high-bandwidth DDR4 Memory (2400 MHz), Adequate high-bandwidth RAM to smoothly run multiple applications and browser tabs all at once. 64GB high-speed eMMC Storage for your office and webinar needs. With 256GB Micro SD Card.
【Ports】1 x USB 3.1 Type-C ports, 2 x USB 3.1 Type-A ports, 1 x HDMI, 1 x Headphone/Microphone Combo Jack, and there's a microSD slot

【Activate 1 Year MS office 365 & Win11 in S mode】(About switch to regular Win11, see the detail in Product description) Activate pre-installed Office: 1.Launch any Office app > 2.Start your activation by signing in with your Microsoft account(Create a account if you don't have one yet) > 3.Click "Activate Office" > 4.Sign in your account and follow the next prompts. > 5.Complete Step 1,2 and 3 > 6.Click on Refresh once Office is ready > 7.Open a document and accept the license agreement.
body.description: Switching out of S mode in Windows 11 Windows 11 in S mode is designed for security and performance, exclusively running apps from the Microsoft Store. If you want to install an app that isn't available in the Microsoft Store, you'll need to switch out of S mode 1. On your PC running Windows 11 in S mode, open Settings > System > Activation. 2. In the Switch to Windows 11 Pro section, select Go to the Store. (If you also see an "Upgrade your edition of Windows" section, be careful not to click the "Go to the Store" link that appears there.) 3. On the Switch out of S mode (or similar) page that appears in the Microsoft Store, select the Get button. After you see a confirmation message on the page, you'll be able to install apps from outside of the Microsoft Store. HP 14 inch Laptop for Business and Student: Sleek design: Easily take this thin and light PC from room to room or on the road Dual array microphones: With two microphones and advanced noise reduction software, you'll always sound crystal clear when you video chat or record Display: 14.0-inch diagonal, HD (1366 x 768), micro-edge, BrightView Processor: Intel Celeron N4120, 4 Cores & 4 Threads Memory: Upgraded to 16GB DDR4 RAM Storage: 64GB eMMC + 256GB Micro SD Card Graphics: Intel UHD Graphics 600 Operating System: Windows 11 Home in S mode HP Fast Charge: Go from 0 to 50% charge in approximately 45 minutes Battery Life: Up to 11 hours and 30 minutes (video playback); Up to 9 hours (wireless streaming) Webcam: HP True Vision 720p HD camera with integrated dual array digital microphones Connectivity: 802.11a/b/g/n/ac (2x2)(19a) Wi-Fi and Bluetooth combo Dimensions: 12.76 x 8.86 x 0.71 inches Weight: 3.24 lbs

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little laptop
reviews.reviewText: Great size for me. I got the light pink one and it is cute. Easy to use and set up. Came with Microsoft 360. Love it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good HP Laptop
reviews.reviewText: I'm not familiar with Windows 11, but once I got it setup it worked great. I did some research online on Windows 11 so I made some changes. I like the SD module that came with it, gives me an extra option for backup. The one thing I struggled with was adding certain programs outside of the Microsoft store, but once I figured it out everything worked good. The laptop was preconfigured in S Mode, which kept pointing me to the Microsoft verified applications. Once I found out where to turn it off it was smooth sailing. It doesn't come with an Ethernet port, so I used a USB port with USB & Ethernet port connector. I like the Ethernet connection, but setting up using wireless worked good. I hope this helps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The delivery guy was great, he delivered with care, unlike Wal-Mart. Very respectful of our property as well, all was caught on camera, as well as the hp laptop because this is being used for home schooling, very pleased with the delivery, transaction, and product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Just what I wanted
reviews.reviewText: Nice computer. Easy to use, lightweight and faster than I expected. I just wanted something to go online with other than my iPhone all the time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not WORTH IT!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this computer for working from home. I just need to access the intranet and a shared drive. I don't do much that requires me to use the space of the computer. So space to save is not an issue. I also just need it to watch Netflix while on down time. This computer is the slowest computer I have ever used. It takes FOREVER to load a page. It takes FOREVER to even pull up Outlook to look at my emails. It takes FOREVER to pull up TEAMS. This by far is the worst purchase I have ever made. I started the computer to get it up and running for work and about an hour in I gave up and closed the computer. It took me an hour just to sign in to Outlook and try and pull up Teams.Save your money and DO NOT BUY this computer. Only if I could return it and get my money back.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Impressive Performance at an Unbeatable Price: A Review of the HP 14 inch HD Laptop
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased the HP 14 inch HD laptop with an Intel Celeron quad core processor, 8 GB DDR4 RAM, and 64 GB storage, and I couldn't be happier with my decision. This laptop is incredibly fast and responsive, making multitasking a breeze. I also love the variety of connectivity options, including Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, HDMI, RJ-45, and USB type A & C. The webcam is high-quality and works excellently for video conferencing. Overall, I highly recommend this laptop to anyone looking for a reliable and high-performance machine. I can't stress enough how exceptional the low price point is for this HP laptop. It's one of the reasons I decided to purchase it, and I'm so glad I did. For such a great price, I got a high-quality, reliable laptop with all of the features it includes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It was kinda slow at first.. i even bought the highest RAM it offered, and i couldn’t even play roblox. it won’t allow you to make google ur default search engine because it’s a type S computer so you are unable to change it to ur preferred search engine. do NOT buy 4-8GB RAM because this will just make it so much slower that it alr is. it’s a decent computer you get what you pay for, but if ur looking for a good computer opt for a lenovo chromebook it’s much cheaper and works like wonders, i just got this one bc mine broke.. also it CAN handle games such as roblox, and is just much faster with its default storage and RAM.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: La laptop fue un regalo para mi hija y esta muy feliz , la recomiendo
